titles.title: Trinity County Land Exchange Act of 2013

To provide for an exchange of land between the United States and the Trinity Public Utilities District of Trinity County, California, involving a parcel of National Forest System land in Shasta-Trinity National Forest.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation.
Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary:
10/23/2013--Introduced. Trinity County Land Exchange Act of 2013 - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture (USDA), if the Trinity Public Utilities District of Trinity County, California, conveys to the Secretary of the Interior all right, title, and interest of the District in the Sky Ranch parcel (Parcel A), to convey to the District all right, title, and interest of the United States in certain land in the Shasta-Trinity National Forest near the Weaverville Airport in Trinity County (Parcel B).
Intends for such land exchange to be an equal value exchange.
Requires the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Redding Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management (BLM), to administer Parcel A as public land.
